---

`r chunk_reveal("gg")`


```{r gg, include = F}
library(rayshader)

diamonds %>% 
  ggplot() +
  aes(x, y = depth) + 
 stat_density_2d(
   aes(fill = stat(nlevel)), 
   geom = "polygon", n = 100, 
   bins = 10,contour = TRUE) +
 facet_wrap(clarity ~ .) +
 scale_fill_viridis_c(option = "A") ->
ggdiamonds

ggdiamonds %>% 
  plot_gg(ggobj = .,
          multicore = TRUE, 
          width = 5, 
          height = 5, 
        scale = 250, 
        windowsize = c(1400,866),
        zoom = 0.55, 
        phi = 30,
        preview = T) 
```



---

```{r}
#Here, I load a map with the raster package.
loadzip = tempfile() 
download.file("https://tylermw.com/data/dem_01.tif.zip", loadzip)
localtif = raster::raster(unzip(loadzip, "dem_01.tif"))
unlink(loadzip)

make_sparse <- function(x, by){
  x[seq(1, nrow(x), by = by), seq(1, ncol(x), by = by) ]
}

#And convert it to a matrix:
full_elmat <- matrix(raster::extract(localtif, raster::extent(localtif), buffer = 1000),
               nrow = ncol(localtif), ncol = nrow(localtif)) 


```

---



`r chunk_reveal("plot_full", break_type = "non_seq", width_code = "29%", width_output = "70%")`

---

`r chunk_reveal("plot_full", width_code = "29%", width_output = "70%")`




```{r plot_full, include = F}  
full_elmat %>% 
  sphere_shade(sunangle = 45, 
               texture = "desert") %>%
  add_water(watermap = detect_water(heightmap = full_elmat), #BREAK2
            color = "desert") %>% #BREAK2
  add_shadow(shadowmap = #BREAK3
               ray_shade(heightmap = full_elmat)) %>% #BREAK3
  add_shadow(shadowmap = #BREAK4
               ambient_shade(heightmap = full_elmat), #BREAK4
             max_darken = .5) %>% #BREAK4
  plot_map() 
```

# Very low resolution

---

`r chunk_reveal("prep2", width_code = "29%", width_output = "70%")`

```{r prep2, include = F}
full_elmat %>% 
  make_sparse(by = 45) ->
elmat

elmat %>% 
  detect_water(heightmap = .) ->
my_water

elmat %>%
  ray_shade(heightmap = .) ->
my_rayshade

elmat %>%
  ambient_shade(heightmap = .) ->
my_ambientshade
```
